articles.title: The Latest: Agency reports progress in fighting twin fires
articles.description: The Latest on the wildfires raging in California (all times local): 5:15 p.m.

articles.title: Astros release statement after activating Roberto Osuna from restricted list
articles.description: Osuna, whom the Astros recently acquired via trade, finished serving his suspension for an alleged domestic-violence incident

articles.author: Jeongmin Kim
articles.title: South Korea's diehard Trump supporters hail 'guardian of liberty'
articles.description: Every time an image of U.S. President Donald Trump appears on TV in South Korea, 69-year-old Vietnam War veteran Chung Seung-jin solemnly salutes.

articles.author: Siobhan Hughes
articles.title: Senators Signal Concerns Over China's Global Investments
articles.description: Several U.S. senators are pressing the Trump administration to detail what it is doing to deal with Beijing’s financing of international infrastructure projects that have left many countries indebted and potentially in need of bailouts.

articles.author: Peter Martinez
articles.title: Baby's body found floating in East River near Brooklyn Bridge, police say
articles.description: Approximately 8-month-old child was discovered Sunday by a family visiting New York City

articles.author: Sean O'Connell
articles.title: Dave Bautista Takes Strongest Stance Against Disney For James Gunn Firing
articles.description: When asked by a fan if he has any plans should Disney and Marvel no reinstate Gunn for Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3 (with indicators saying Gunn will NOT be rehired), Bautista replied with candor.

articles.author: Erin Kelly
articles.title: President Trump: Donald Jr. did nothing illegal in meeting Russian attorney to get 'dirt' on Clinton
articles.description: President Donald Trump defended his eldest son, insisting that the meeting  Donald Trump Jr. had in June 2016 with a Russian attorney at Trump Tower to get "dirt" on Hillary Clinton was "totally legal."

articles.author: Jay Croft and Deanna Hackney, CNN
articles.title: In 14 hours on Sunday in Chicago, 44 people were shot, including 5 who died, police say
articles.description: Chicago police records show 44 people were shot on Sunday, including five who were killed.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Small plane crashes in California parking lot, killing 5
articles.description: Official says the pilot declared an emergency before crashing about a mile from John Wayne Airport in Orange County

articles.title: Demi Lovato Pens Statement After Overdose: 'I Now Need Time to Heal and Focus on My Sobriety'
articles.description: Music, Film, TV and Political News Coverage

articles.author: CBS/AP
articles.title: Hurricane Hector becomes Category 4 storm, heads toward Hawaii
articles.description: The center of Hector is expected to pass south of Hawaii's Big Island by Wednesday or Thursday

articles.title: Polls Show Close Race In Key Ohio Special Election
articles.description: Ohio holds a special congressional election on Tuesday. NPR's Don Gonyea and former Ohio Republican Party Chairman Matt Borges talk about why this deep red district seems to be up for grabs.

articles.title: Heat Advisory in effect in NYC, heat index values reach into the 90s
articles.description: New Yorkers are advised to check in on elderly neighbors.

articles.title: Is Cuomo Threatening NRA's Existence? He Says: 'I'd Like To Believe It's True.'
articles.description: New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo says the National Rifle Association's lawsuit against him is "frivolous." The lawsuit claims that Cuomo's policies are trying to deprive it of its First Amendment rights.

articles.author: Elizabeth Weise
articles.title: Heat wave could be behind Swiss crash of vintage plane that killed 20 in the Alps
articles.description: All 20 people aboard an old-time propeller plane were killed when the aircraft crashed into a mountainside in the Alps in southeast Switzerland.

articles.title: CBS Entertainment Head Defends Company's Culture Amid Les Moonves Scandal

articles.title: For 'Christopher Robin,' Outselling Tom Cruise Is an Impossible Mission
articles.description: “Mission: Impossible — Fallout” was the No. 1 movie in North America for the second weekend in a row, beating Disney’s new Winnie-the-Pooh film.

articles.title: Terrell Owens finally explains why he had a nearly 15-year beef with the media
articles.description: T.O. has an explanation for why he's not a big fan of the media

articles.title: Portland police arrest four in far-right rally and counter-protest
articles.description: Police used stun grenades to disperse rallies as far-right groups were met by counter-protesters.

articles.author: Tim Rostan
articles.title: Newseum bows to media pressure and discontinues sale of 'fake news' T-shirt
articles.description: The Newseum, a 21-year-old Washington, D.C., attraction that describes its mission as “to increase public understanding of the importance of a free press and the First Amendment,” came under fire this week when it was reported that it was selling gift-shop it…
